Authors:
Napalai Chaiwan, Ishara Manawasinghe, Mingkhuan Doilom,
Ruvishika Shehali Jayawardena, Timur S. Bulgakov
Title:
New host record of Nothophoma quercina. (Pleosporales,
Didymellaceae) from Ulmus minor × Ulmus pumila in Russia
Keywords:
Ascomycota  phylogeny  saprobe  single spore isolation 
taxonomy
Abstract:
A fungus was collected from a dead twig of Ulmus minor ´
Ulmus pumila in Southern European Russia. The phylogenetic analysis
based on combined gene regions of Internal transcribed spacer (ITS),
large subunit of nuclear ribosomal RNA (LSU), beta-tubulin (TUB2) and
the second largest subunit of nuclear RNA polymerase II (RPB2) sequence
dataset shows that species clusters within the genus Nothophoma.
Morphological characteristics and phylogenetic results confirmed that
the fungus is Nothophoma quercina. Since this is the first report of N.
quercina from Ulmus, we report this species as a new host record from
Ulmus minor × Ulmus pumila in Russia. A detailed description, colour
photographs and a phylogenetic tree to show the placement of N. quercina
are given.
